issue.title: [ENH] adding compatibility with probabilistic and hierarchical forecasts to `ForecastingPipeline` and `TransformedTargetForecaster`

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
This PR adds compatibility of `ForecastingPipeline` and `TransformedTargetForecaster` with:
* the probabilistic forecasting interface points `predict_interval` etc
* hierarchical and panel inputs for hierarchical, panel, global forecasting

This PR alsp:
* fixes `_has_capability` for the case where tags can be dynamic (such as here)
* adds test parameters to `ForecastingPipeline` and `TransformedTargetForecaster` that cover the probabilistic case
* fixes one missing argument of `_predict_proba` in the extension template.
* adds a `_transform` to the `ForecastingPipeline`.
* fixes a broken error message in the `test_pred_int_tag` test
* fixes `BaseForecaster` which was missing the `marginal` arg in `predict_proba`.

Addresses parts of #2088, #2243, #2313.

Contains the fixes in https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/2322 which are necessary for tests not to break, since `_has_capability` has changed and that uncovers the issues with `inverse_transform` etc in #2322.

issue.title: [ENH] Grid Search for Global Models

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
It looks like Grid Search is not enabled on Global Forecasting yet (no support for multi-index). I was wondering if this is planned. For example, I would like to be able to run the global model, but tune the hyperparameters of the regressor. I was wondering if this is planned for the future? Thanks!

Details here: https://nbviewer.org/gist/ngupta23/138f55d72f2764b47711c97a73de631d

```python
kwargs = WindowSummarizer.get_test_params()[0]

forecaster = make_reduction(
    RandomForestRegressor(max_depth=100),
    scitype="tabular-regressor",
    transformers=[WindowSummarizer(**kwargs)],
    window_length=None,
)

fh = np.arange(1, 13)

from sktime.forecasting.model_selection import ExpandingWindowSplitter, ForecastingGridSearchCV
cv = ExpandingWindowSplitter(fh=np.arange(1, 13))
param_grid = {"estimator__max_depth" : [100, 200, 300]}
gscv = ForecastingGridSearchCV(
    forecaster=forecaster,
    param_grid=param_grid,
    cv=cv)

try:
    # y_grouped is multiindex (2 levels)
    gscv.fit(y_grouped)
    y_pred = gscv.predict()
except NotImplementedError as e:
    print(e)
```
```python
<class 'pandas.core.indexes.multi.MultiIndex'> is not supported for input, use one of (<class 'pandas.core.indexes.range.RangeIndex'>, <class 'pandas.core.indexes.period.PeriodIndex'>, <class 'pandas.core.indexes.datetimes.DatetimeIndex'>, <class 'pandas.core.indexes.timedeltas.TimedeltaIndex'>) instead.
```

body:
transformer and forecasting pipelines are in 0.11.2:
https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/2318

issue.title: [ENH] extend `evaluate` to hierarchical and panel data

labels.name: implementing framework
labels.description: Implementing frameworks for new learning tasks

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
Carries out item from https://github.com/sktime/sktime/issues/2243.

Extends `evaluate` to accept hierarchical `X` and `y`.

By extension, should enable `GridSearchCV` to handle hierarchical data and resolve bug https://github.com/sktime/sktime/issues/3464.

Less hacky version of https://github.com/sktime/sktime/pull/3509 which uses the centralized checker functions and hierarchical functionality of splitters instead of custom duplicates.

FYI @aiwalter, @danbartl, @ngupta23

issue.title: [ENH] extend forecasting grid/random search to hierarchical and panel data

labels.name: interfacing algorithms
labels.description: Interfacing existing algorithms/estimators for other packages

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
Carries out item from https://github.com/sktime/sktime/issues/2243.

Extends `ForecastingGridSearchCV` and `ForecastingRandomSearchCV` to work with hierarchical and panel type data.

Adds a test to check the hierarchical/panel logic.

Builds on and includes https://github.com/sktime/sktime/pull/3542.
